Easy Sweet Recipe: India ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡³Â  Servings : 15 Duration : 45 mins Laddu is very famous sweet in India ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡³ In most of the occasions, festivals and in temples they serve Laddu as dessert. In south India Laddu is a special Â dish and it's must on wedding ceremony. On Ganesh Chaturthi, I like to prepare laddu because it's favorite to Lord Ganesha. Laddu can be made with Bengal gram powder/ Besan powder with sugar powder/ sugar syrup and cardamom powder to enhance the taste. Finally it will be garnished with cashew nuts/pistachio/badam/ Almonds pieces and raisins depends on the cuisine. The process varies from recipe to recipe in making of Laddu. There are various types of Laddu available in India. Today, I prepared simple and delicious Besan Laddu ðŸ˜‹ Let's start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients: Besan / Bengal gram flour Â - 1 bowl Ghee - melted - half bowl Sugar - 235 gms - 1 cup Cashew nuts - chopped - 1/2 cup Procedure:
  • Blend sugar and make smooth powder. Keep it aside
  • Heat frying pan on low to medium heat
  • Add chopped cashew nuts
  • Fry till golden brown and take out in a cup
  • Add Besan/ Bengal Gram flour in hot ghee
  • Mix it well with spatula
  • It's becomes like lump and smoothy
  • Saute continuously for 30 mins till the color changes and aroma comes out
  • When it becomes non-sticky to pan
  • Turn off burner/ cooktop
  • Let it become cool for 20 mins
  • Add powdered sugar
  • Mix it well with hands and make dough
  • Make small balls
  • Garnish with fried cashew nuts
  • Easy sweet recipe Besan Laddu is ready
  • Hope all of you get blessings from Lord Ganesha. Have a Happy Ganesh Chaturthi ðŸ˜€
